text: [Music]
my name is Dave Gardner I'm the chief
technology officer at Legends of
learning legends of learning is the
largest marketplace for game based
learning in the United States for k-12
we have a library of over 1,200 games
for science and soon-to-be math
curriculum so that covers 3rd through
8th grade curriculum as well as targeted
towards state standards so our mission
is to expand the way that people learn
through games 60% of adults are gamers
and most parents believe that games can
have educational values for their
children as a small company there's
really no way that we'd be able to
achieve what we have made possible
without the support of AWS so things
like DevOps with a really small
engineering team we're able to produce
things on a scale that wouldn't have
been possible otherwise also AWS really
helps us with our roadmap because we can
be confident that as we scale the tools
will be available to us when we need
them and even the small things like SFTP
and VPN you know things that are a heavy
lift but don't add a whole lot of
differentiation for us it's really
important for us to be able to get those
really out of the box from AWS we
primarily use AWS 4 RDS database
technologies we use Athena we're
experimenting with Sage maker ec2 we use
s3 as a way to collaborate with our game
developers as well as cloud front cloud
front really gives us the ability to
deliver game downloads in the classroom
with really high speed being at the
builders workshop today has been really
great had an opportunity to network with
a lot of other CTOs and CEOs from ed
tech startups so just really hearing
about what other people are doing is an
eye-opener to new opportunities for us
also the solutions architects are great
it's been really helpful to have them as
a point of contact they'll go out of
their way to spend hours solving a
problem that I just really don't have
time to do myself and it's a lifesaver
[Music]
